member.summary: Gets or sets object that indicates the margin info of the paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.ID
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the ID of the paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.IsFirstParagraph
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the paragraph is the first paragraph of a page. If this property is set to true,Aspose.Pdf will start a new page for this paragraph.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.IsFirstParagraphInColumn
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the paragraph be the first paragraph of a column.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.IsKeptTogether
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether all lines in the paragraph are to remain on the same page. Default is false. This property only affects paragraphs in section (but not in table).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.IsKeptWithNext
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether current paragraph remains in the same page along with next paragraph. Default is false. This property only affects paragraphs in section (but ont in table) except FloatingBox, which position is set by manual.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.IsDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether this paragraph is disabled. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, this paragraph will not be rendered.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.IsInList
member.summary: Get or set a bool value that indicates whether this paragraph is used as a list item. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, this paragraph will appear in the list when the list is constructed.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.IsOnOddPage
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether this paragraph be shown in odd page only. This property used for duplex Printing. If you want to print a paragraph in a new odd page in duplex Printing,you can set "IsFirstParagraph = true" and "IsOnOddPage = true".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.Left
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the left position of the paragraph. The unit is point.
member.remarks: The property is used for custom positioning. You need not use this property if you want the paragraph be auto aligned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.Top
member.summary: Gets or sets a float value that indicates the top position of the paragraph. The unit is point.
member.remarks: The property is used for custom positioning. You need not use this property if you want the paragraph be auto aligned.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.PositioningType
member.summary: The positioning type for custom positioning. Default value is Auto (don not use custom positioning).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph.ReferenceParagraphID
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the reference paragraph when using paragraph relative customer positioning.
member.remarks: The reference paragraph must be ahead of the current paragraph in the document object model.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.BorderInfo
member.summary: Encapsulates the border info for the , and .

example.code:
[C#] Pdf pdf1 = new Pdf(); Section sec1 = pdf1.Sections.Add(); Aspose.Pdf.Table table1 = new Aspose.Pdf.Table(); sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1); table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm"; Row row1 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row1 = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2"); cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2; cell1Row1.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Row row2 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell1"); cell1Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Cell cell2Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell2"); cell2Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F,new Aspose.Pdf.Color("Red")); pdf1.Save(...); [Visual Basic] Dim pdf1 As Pdf = New Pdf() Dim sec1 As Section = pdf1.Sections.Add() Dim table1 As Aspose.Pdf.Table = New Aspose.Pdf.Table() sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1) table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm" Dim row1 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row1 As Cell = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2") cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1Row1.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim row2 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell1") cell1Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim cell2Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell2") cell2Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5, New Aspose.Pdf.Color("Red")) pdf1.Save(...) [XML]
ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1 cell2

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.ColumnInfo.ColumnWidths
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the width of columns in each page in the section. The value of each column should be separated by blank.The default unit is point, but cm, inch and percentage of available width are also supported.For example,"120 2.5cm 1.5inch",or "60% 40%". The max column number is 16.
member.remarks: If this property is not set, column width will be calculated automatically according to and .

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.ColumnInfo.ColumnSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that contains the spacing between columns in each page in the section. The value of each spacing should be separated by blank. The default unit is point, but cm and inch are also supported.For example,"120 2.5cm 1.5inch".
member.remarks: If this property is not set, default value 1.25cm will be used for each spacing.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Text.IsSpaced
member.summary:
Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the spaces at the begin of the text and returns in the text be shown. For the following XML:
<Text> <Segment>The first line, The second line.</Segment> </Text>
If IsSpaced is false, the result will be:
The first line,The second line.
If IsSpaced is true, the result will be:
The first line, The second line.

NOTE: This property is now obsolete. Web image can be supported by setting the URL in Image.ImageInfo.File.You need not set this property any more. For CCITT image, please use ImageInfo.CcittImageWidth instead. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.0.0.0 in April 2006. member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.License
member.summary: Provides methods to license the component.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of this class.
member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As license = New license License.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic")

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.SetLicense(System.String)
member.summary: Licenses the component.

remarks.p: Tries to find the license in the following locations:
2. The folder of the component assembly.
3. The folder of the client's calling assembly.
4. The folder of the entry assembly.
5. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.
Note:On the .NET Compact Framework, tries to find the license only in these locations:
2. An embedded resource in the client's calling assembly.

member.example:
In this example, an attempt will be made to find a license file named MyLicense.lic in the folder that contains
the component, in the folder that contains the calling assembly, in the folder of the entry assembly and then in the embedded resources of the calling assembly.
[C#]
License license = new License(); license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic");
[Visual Basic]
Dim license As License = New License license.SetLicense("MyLicense.lic") Can be a full or short file name or name of an embedded resource. Use an empty string to switch to evaluation mode.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.License.SetLicense(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Licenses the component.
member.param: A stream that contains the license.

remarks.p: Use this method to load a license from a stream.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Section.AddParagraph(Aspose.Pdf.Paragraph)
member.summary: Add a paragraph into the section. This method is used in direct-to-file mode.That means all paragraphs will be rendered into pdf file without being saved in the document object model. Less memory will be consumed in this mode,but you can't access the paragraphs that be added into the document any more, so some of the advanced features such as combination of XML and API,hyperlink to specified paragraph,total page number in footer,etc.,is not available.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Section.IsSpaced
member.summary:
Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the spaces at the begin of the text and returns in the text be shown. For the following XML:
<Text> <Segment>The first line, The second line.</Segment> </Text>
If IsSpaced is false, the result will be:
The first line,The second line.
If IsSpaced is true, the result will be:
The first line, The second line.

member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the crop box of the page.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PageSetup.BleedBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the bleed box of the page. The bleed box (PDF 1.3) defines the region to which the contents of the page should be clipped when output in a production environment. This may include any extra bleed area needed to accommodate the physical limitations of cutting, folding, and trimming equipment. The actual printed page may include printing marks that fall outside the bleed box.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PageSetup.ArtBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the art box of the page. The art box (PDF 1.3) defines the extent of the pages meaningful content (including potential white space) as intended by the pages creator.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PageSetup.TrimBox
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the trim box of the page. The trim box (PDF 1.3) defines the intended dimensions of the finished page after trimming. It may be smaller than the media box, to allow for productionrelated content such as printing instructions, cut marks, or color bars.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PageSetup.PageBorder
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the page border.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.PageSetup.PageBorderMargin
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the margin between the page border and the page edge. The default value is half of the page margin.

member.summary: Enumerates transition types for page transition effects when revealing the new page.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.Split
member.summary: Two lines sweep across the screen.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.Blinds
member.summary: Multiple lines,evenly spaced across the screen,synchronously sweep in the same direction.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.Box
member.summary: A rectangular box sweeps inward from the edges of the page or outward from the center.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.Wipe
member.summary: A single line sweeps across the screen from one edge to the other.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.Dissolve
member.summary: The old page dissolves gradually.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.Glitter
member.summary: Similar to Dissolve except that the effect sweeps across the page in a wide band moving from one side of the screen to the other.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.Replace
member.summary: The new page simply replaces the old one with no special transition effect.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PageTransitionType.None
member.summary: No transition.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.Credentials
member.summary: Specifies credentials to use to connect to an external URL that required authentication.
member.value: An instance of an object that implements ICredentials.
member.remarks: If the page you are accessing requires authentication or the page contains external reference URLs that require authentication, you will need to create a functional ICredentials object and assign it to the Credentials property. This property needs to be assigned before the call to is made.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.#ctor(System.IO.FileStream)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for Evaluation License. You can use SetLicense method to set license if you have purchased license.If you use this constructor,the component will work in direct-to-file mode. That means all paragraphs will be rendered into pdf file without being saved in the document object model. Less memory will be consumed in this mode,but you can't access the paragraphs that be added into the document any more, so some of the advanced features such as combination of XML and API,hyperlink to specified paragraph,total page number in footer,etc.,is not available.
member.param: The stream to write the document.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.Close
member.summary: Close the document. This method is used for direct-to-file mode only.

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.SetLicenseCOM(System.String)
member.summary: Obsolete. Licenses this component to use in a COM application.

remarks.p: Use this class for licenses purchased before 2005/01/22. Aspose has upgraded to a new licensing system, please use License. for licenses purchased after that date.

example.code: Set pdf1 = server.CreateObject("Aspose.Pdf.Pdf") pdf1.SetLicenseCOM("e:\projects\CSharp\customer\Aspose.Pdf.lic") set sec1 = server.CreateObject("Aspose.Pdf.Section") pdf1.Sections.Add(sec1) set t1 = server.CreateObject("Aspose.Pdf.Text") set s1 = server.CreateObject("Aspose.Pdf.Segment") s1.Content = "hello" t1.Segments.Add(s1) sec1.Paragraphs.Add(t1) pdf1.Save("test.Pdf")

member.param: The license filename with its path.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsSpaced
member.summary:
Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the spaces at the begin of the text and returns in the text be shown. For the following XML:
<Text> <Segment>The first line, The second line.</Segment> </Text>
If IsSpaced is false, the result will be:
The first line,The second line.
If IsSpaced is true, the result will be:
The first line, The second line.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsImagesInXmlDeleteNeeded
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether images used in XML be deleted when the PDF document is generated.
member.remarks: This property is used when integration with Aspose.Word. When converting Word document to PDF, Aspose.Word will save images in Word document as file and add the file name into XML. If this property is set to true,Aspose.Pdf will delete these image files used in XML.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsBuffered
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether memory buffer is used when generating PDF document. The default value is true. If this property is set to false, Aspose.Pdf will write document directly to PDF file and the method can't be used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsBookmarked
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the pdf document is bookmarked when generating PDF document. The default value is false. If this property is set to true, Aspose.Pdf will create bookmarks for all the s in the PDF if the relative property is not set.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.BookMarkLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets a int value that indicates how many levels of of the pdf document is to be bookmarked. The default value is 0, which means every heading of the PDF is to be taged as a bookmark. Only when the relative property is set as true, this property is valid. If is true and this property is set to a non-integer value levelNumber, Aspose.Pdf will create bookmarks for the corresponding s of level 1 to level levelNumber.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.TabStopPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the tab stop position. Default value is 36 points (0.5inch).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.HtmlInfo
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the necessary info when converting HTML to PDF.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsPageNumberRestarted
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the page number is restarted in new section. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsCoreFontUsed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether PDF core fonts are used. Default is true. If this property is set to false, PDF core fonts will be ignored and all font will be used as TrueType font.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsXmlSchemaCheckedOnBind
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the error is ignored when unknown elements or attributes are used in xml file. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsPageNumberForDocument
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether total page number is count for whole document. If this property is set to true, the "$P" symbol will be replaced by the total page number of the document. Otherwise "$P" will be replaced with the total page number of all sections that were not restarted ("IsPageNumberRestarted" is set to true).

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsTruetypeFontMapCached
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether truetype font map be cached on disk. Truetype font map is a font name to font file name map which is used when using unicode. If unicode is used, setting this property to true can make your application run fast. If this property is set to true and the system's fonts are changed (for example, new fonts are installed), delete the font map file (Aspose.Pdf.TruetypeFontMap.xml) and it will be generated again automatically.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.TruetypeFontMapPath
member.summary: Gets or set a string that indicates the path of the truetype font map file. This property is valid only when the "IsTruetypeFontMapCached" property is set to true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.TruetypeFontMapStream
member.summary: Gets or set a memory stream that indicates the TrueType font map stream. This property is valid only when the "IsTruetypeFontMapCached" property is set to true. Normally you should use "TruetypeFontMapPath" instead of this property. But in some server, it is not permitted to create file on disk so you can use TrueType font map stream. You need to create the font map stream only once when you application is running.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.PageCount
member.summary: Gets a int value that indicates the pages count of the generated PDF. You can only get the value of this property when the method is called.

member.summary: Gets or sets a which will be added upon the PDF document.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.DefaultFontName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the default font name. When font name is not set or the font is not found, this font will be used. The default value is "Times-Roman".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsRightToLeft
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the text or heading appear in the pdf is right-to-left aligned. If it is true, all the texts and headings will be processed as right-to-left language previously. If text or heading don't contain any right-to-left lanuage character, they will be processed as usual( left-to-right). This property is used for right-to-left aligned language such as Arabic and Hebrew.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.IsRtlInSegmentMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the text or heading is processed in segment mode. If it is true(default),segment in text will be processed one by one. If false, all segments in text will be put together, reorder in arabic rule. We recommend set it true when rendering rtl and non-rtl mixed texts.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.Bookmarks
member.summary: Gets or sets a object that indicates the bookmarks in the PDF.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Pdf.Conformance
member.summary:
NOTE: This is Beta version of PdfA1B.
Gets or sets a object that indicates the conformance in the PDF. The default value is PdfConformance.None . you need to set this property before Save method is called . Notice that PdfConformance.PdfA1B currently only support TrueType fonts and RGB color , specify a wrong font name or a CMYK color will cause exception.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.PdfConformance
member.summary: Enumeration for PDF/A1. PDF/A1 attempts to maximize:Device independence,Self-containment and Self-documentation . The constraints include: Audio and video content are forbidden, Javascript and executable file launches are prohibited , All fonts must be embedded and also must be legally embeddable for unlimited, universal rendering , Colorspaces specified in a device-independent manner , Encryption is disallowed, Use of standards-based metadata is mandated the files.

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfConformance.None
member.summary: No conformance

member.name: F:Aspose.Pdf.PdfConformance.PdfA1B
member.summary: Part 1 of the PDF/A ISO standard [ISO 19005-1:2005] is a constrained form of Adobe PDF version 1.4 intended to be suitable for long-term preservation of page-oriented documents for which PDF is already being used in practice. Level B conformance (PDF-1b) indicates minimal compliance to ensure that the rendered visual appearance of a conforming file is preservable over the long term. Level A conformance (PDF-1a) indicates complete compliance with the ISO 19005-1 requirements, including those related to structural and semantic properties of documents.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Row
member.summary: Repserents a row in a .

example.code:
[C#] Pdf pdf1 = new Pdf(); Section sec1 = pdf1.Sections.Add(); Aspose.Pdf.Table table1 = new Aspose.Pdf.Table(); sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1); table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm"; Row row1 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row1 = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2"); cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2; cell1Row1.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Row row2 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell1"); cell1Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Cell cell2Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell2"); cell2Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F,new Aspose.Pdf.Color("Red")); pdf1.Save(...); [Visual Basic] Dim pdf1 As Pdf = New Pdf() Dim sec1 As Section = pdf1.Sections.Add() Dim table1 As Aspose.Pdf.Table = New Aspose.Pdf.Table() sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1) table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm" Dim row1 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row1 As Cell = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2") cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1Row1.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim row2 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell1") cell1Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim cell2Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell2") cell2Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5, New Aspose.Pdf.Color("Red")) pdf1.Save(...) [XML]
ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1 cell2

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.Is128BitsEncrypted
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the Pdf documents will be 128 bits or 40 bits encrypted. Default is false, 40 bits encrypted.

member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the user password used in pdf encryption.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.MasterPassword
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the master password used in pdf encryption.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsPrintingAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether printing is allowed. Default is true.
member.remarks: To fully disable Pdf documents to be printable both and should be false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsContentsModifyingAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether modifying contents is allowed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsCopyingAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether copying or otherwise extracting text and graphics from the document is allowed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsAnnotationsModifyingAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether adding or modifying text annotations is allowed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsFormFillingAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether filling in forms and signing the document is allowed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsScreenReadersAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether screen readers are allowed. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsDocumentAssemblyingAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether assembling the document is allowed. This includes inserting, rotating, or deleting pages and creating navigation elements such as bookmarks or thumbnail images. Default is true.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsDegradedPrintingAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether printing in low resolution is allowed. Default is true.
member.remarks: To fully disable Pdf documents to be printable both and should be false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Security.IsDefaultAllAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates if all permissions are set to allowed as default. Default value is true. If this property is set to false, then all permissions are set to NOT allowed.

member.name: T:Aspose.Pdf.Table
member.summary: Represents a table in a Pdf document.

example.code:
[C#] Pdf pdf1 = new Pdf(); Section sec1 = pdf1.Sections.Add(); Aspose.Pdf.Table table1 = new Aspose.Pdf.Table(); sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1); table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm"; Row row1 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row1 = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2"); cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2; cell1Row1.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Row row2 = table1.Rows.Add(); Cell cell1Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell1"); cell1Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F); Cell cell2Row2 = row2.Cells.Add("cell2"); cell2Row2.Border = new BorderInfo((int)BorderSide.All,0.5F,new Aspose.Pdf.Color("Red")); pdf1.Save(...); [Visual Basic] Dim pdf1 As Pdf = New Pdf() Dim sec1 As Section = pdf1.Sections.Add() Dim table1 As Aspose.Pdf.Table = New Aspose.Pdf.Table() sec1.Paragraphs.Add(table1) table1.ColumnWidths = "70 2cm" Dim row1 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row1 As Cell = row1.Cells.Add("ColumnsSpan = 2") cell1Row1.ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1Row1.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim row2 As Row = table1.Rows.Add() Dim cell1Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell1") cell1Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5) Dim cell2Row2 As Cell = row2.Cells.Add("cell2") cell2Row2.Border = New BorderInfo(CType(BorderSide.All, Integer), 0.5, New Aspose.Pdf.Color("Red")) pdf1.Save(...) [XML]
ColumnsSpan = 2 cell1 cell2

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.GetMinColumnWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the minimum column width at which no hyphenation needs for all cells in the column. Note that you can only use this method to get the minimum width for text paragraphs in the column. Other paragraph such as image will be ignored. NOTE: This member is now obsolete. You should use GetMinColumnWidth(Pdf pdf,int columnNumber) which has better performance. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.0.0.0 in April 2006. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.
member.param: The column number which begins at 0.
member.returns: The minimum with for the column.

example.code:
[C#] ... tab1.ImportArray(darr,0,0,true); tab1.SetColumnWidth(2,tab1.GetMinColumnWidth(2)); ...
[VisualBasic] tab1.ImportArray(darr,0,0,true) tab1.SetColumnWidth(2,tab1.GetMinColumnWidth(2))

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.GetMinColumnWidth(Aspose.Pdf.Pdf,System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the minimum column width at which no hyphenation needs for all cells in the column. Note that you can only use this method to get the minimum width for text paragraphs in the column. Other paragraph such as image will be ignored.
member.param: The object that indicates the PDF document.
The column number which begins at 0.
member.returns: The minimum with for the column.

example.code:
[C#] ... tab1.ImportArray(darr,0,0,true); tab1.SetColumnWidth(2,tab1.GetMinColumnWidth(pdf,2)); ...
[VisualBasic] tab1.ImportArray(darr,0,0,true) tab1.SetColumnWidth(2,tab1.GetMinColumnWidth(pdf,2))

member.name: M:Aspose.Pdf.Table.GetMaxColumnWidth(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the maximum column width which allows text in all cells in the column be shown in one line. For example,if the text is "Thank you for considering Aspose", will return the width of "considering",and this method will return the width of "Thank you for considering Aspose". Note that you can only use this method to get the maximum width for text paragraphs in the column. Other paragraph such as image will be ignored. NOTE: This member is now obsolete. You should use GetMinColumnWidth(Pdf pdf,int columnNumber) which has better performance. It will be removed 12 months later since release 3.0.0.0 in April 2006. Aspose apologizes for any inconvenience you may have experienced.
member.param: The column number which begins at 0.
member.returns: The maximum with for the column.

example.code:
[C#] ... tab1.ImportArray(darr,0,0,true); tab1.SetColumnWidth(2,tab1.GetMaxColumnWidth(2)); ...
[VisualBasic] tab1.ImportArray(darr,0,0,true) tab1.SetColumnWidth(2,tab1.GetMaxColumnWidth(2))

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.Table.IsEmptyRowAtBottomShown
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates if the empty row at the bottom of the table be shown in the PDF. When a table is larger and can't be display in one page, the table will be splited into more tables. Sometimes the broken table has a empty row at the bottom. This property is used to control the displaying of the empty row. The default value is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.FontName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the text font name. Default is Times-Roman.
member.remarks: In Aspose.Pdf,three types of fonts is supported. The first type is base 14 font which are Courier,Courier-Bold,Courier-BoldOblique,Courier-Oblique,Helvetica,Helvetica-Bold,Helvetica-BoldOblique, Helvetica-Oblique,Symbol,Times-Bold,Times-BoldItalic,Times-Italic,Times-Roman and ZapfDingbats. Only font name are needed when using these fonts. The second type is postscript font. User should set the FontAfmFile or FontPfmFile,FontEncodingFile and FontOutlineFile if want to embed font. The last type is truetype font. User need to install the truetype font if it is not installed in the system. Truetype font with unicode is supported. TruetypeFontFileName should be set when unicode is used. We recommend that you use truetype font instead of postscript font becouse some type of postscript fonts are not supported.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.FontEncoding
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the font encoding name. For 8-bit fonts, encoding should be "builtin"(Original encoding used by non-text or non-Latin text fonts) , or "winansi"(Windows code page 1252), or the name of an external encoding("cp1251" for example). The default value is "winansi".

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.IsUnicode
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether unicode is used.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.IsFontEmbedded
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates if the font is embedded. Default is false.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.FontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets a float number that indicates the size of font. Unit is point. Default is 12.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.IsTrueTypeFontBold
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the TrueType font is bold.
member.remarks: Valid for TrueType fonts only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.IsTrueTypeFontItalic
member.summary: Gets or sets a bool value that indicates whether the TrueType font is italic.
member.remarks: Valid for TrueType fonts only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.FontAfmFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the name of custom AFM font file.
member.remarks: Valid for custom PostScript fonts only. You need to assign either or . If both are assigned will be evaluated first.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.FontPfmFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the name of custom PFM font file.
member.remarks: Valid for custom PostScript fonts only. You need to assign either or . If both are assigned will be evaluated first.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.FontOutlineFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the name of custom font outline file. This property is needed when embedding custom PostScript font into PDF files.

remarks.b: Valid for custom PostScript fonts only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.FontEncodingFile
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the name of font encoding file. Font encoding files are available at http://www.unicode.org/Public/MAPPINGS/VENDORS/MICSFT/WINDOWS/ and http://www.unicode.org/Public/MAPPINGS/ISO8859/.The font encoding name is same as the encoding file name. For example, the encoding file is 'cp1250.txt' and the encoding name is 'cp1250';the encoding file is '8859-1.TXT' and the encoding name is '8859-1'.

remarks.b: Valid for custom PostScript fonts only.

member.name: P:Aspose.Pdf.TextInfo.TruetypeFontFileName
member.summary: Gets or sets a string that indicates the truetype font file name. This property is only needed when using truetype font with unicode. If your truetype font has been installed in your system, you can use truetype font with unicode without this property. But using this property will greatly improve the performance.
